step1.description: Parkin's Uld domain interacts with Rpn10 subunit of proteasome, critical for AR-JP pathogenesis.

step2.description: MD simulations model structural stability and proteasome interaction, directly relevant to disease mechanism.

substep3a.description: Abstract lacks explicit mention of controls or replicates.

substep3b.description: MD simulations are standard in structural biology; methodologically accepted.

substep3c.description: No mention of control variants (pathogenic/benign) in the abstract.

substep4a.description: No OddsPath values or statistical metrics (p-values, effect sizes) reported in the abstract.

substep4b.description: Number of control variants not specified in the abstract.

functional_evidence.reasoning: MD simulations are validated techniques, but lack of controls/replicates and odds path data limits strength to 'supporting'.
